findings.title: World-readable sensitive file: exec-approvals.json
findings.description: The file 'C:\Users\dsinh\agentsec-dev\agentsec\.tmp\repro-case1\.openclaw\exec-approvals.json' is readable by all users on the system. Any local process or user can read its contents, which may include API keys, tokens, and other credentials.

remediation.summary: Restrict permissions on exec-approvals.json to owner-only
steps: Verify no other processes depend on group/world access

findings.title: World-readable sensitive file: openclaw.json
findings.description: The file 'C:\Users\dsinh\agentsec-dev\agentsec\.tmp\repro-case1\.openclaw\openclaw.json' is readable by all users on the system. Any local process or user can read its contents, which may include API keys, tokens, and other credentials.

remediation.summary: Restrict permissions on openclaw.json to owner-only
steps: Verify no other processes depend on group/world access

findings.title: Agent config directory world-accessible: .openclaw
findings.description: The directory 'C:\Users\dsinh\agentsec-dev\agentsec\.tmp\repro-case1\.openclaw' is accessible by all users. This directory contains agent configuration, credentials, session history, and exec approvals.

findings.title: Gateway bound to non-loopback interface
findings.description: The OpenClaw Gateway is configured with bind='0.0.0.0', exposing the control interface beyond localhost. Unless protected by a firewall and strong auth, this allows remote attackers to interact with the agent directly.

remediation.summary: Bind Gateway to loopback or add strong authentication
steps: If remote access is needed, use a reverse proxy with auth
Ensure firewall rules restrict access to trusted IPs

findings.title: No WebSocket origin validation configured
findings.description: The WebSocket server does not validate the Origin header. This enables Cross-Site WebSocket Hijacking from malicious webpages.

findings.title: Gateway auth missing on non-loopback interface
findings.description: The Gateway is bound to '0.0.0.0' but has no authentication configured. Any device on the network can control the agent.

steps: Prefer token-based auth for programmatic access

findings.title: DM policy set to 'open' — anyone can message the agent
findings.description: The agent accepts direct messages from anyone without pairing or allowlisting. This makes the agent a direct target for prompt injection attacks from untrusted users.

remediation.summary: Restrict DM access to paired/allowlisted users

findings.title: Group policy is 'open' — agent responds in any group
findings.description: The agent will respond to messages in any group it's added to. In large or public groups, untrusted users can inject prompts and trigger tool execution.

remediation.summary: Restrict group policy to allowlisted groups
steps: Maintain an explicit list of trusted group IDs

findings.title: Full tool profile with open inbound access
findings.description: tools.profile is 'unset (defaults to full)' and the agent accepts messages from untrusted sources. This gives prompt-injected inputs access to all tools including exec, browser, and filesystem.

remediation.summary: Restrict tool profile for untrusted input routes
steps: Explicitly allow only needed tools via tools.allow

findings.title: Sandboxing disabled with full tool access and open input
findings.description: The agent has full tool access and accepts untrusted input, but sandboxing is not enabled. Without container isolation, compromised tool calls run directly on the host.

findings.title: Authentication disabled on non-loopback agent
findings.description: The agent is accessible beyond localhost but has no authentication configured. Anyone who can reach the interface can issue commands and access credentials.

steps: Set a strong, unique access token

findings.title: No SSRF protection configured for URL-based inputs
findings.description: The agent can process URL-based inputs (input_file, input_image) but has no SSRF deny policy or hostname allowlist configured. Attackers can use the agent to scan internal networks, access cloud metadata endpoints (169.254.169.254), or exfiltrate data to external servers.
findings.evidence: security.ssrf.denyPolicy and hostnameAllowlist are both absent

remediation.summary: Configure SSRF deny policy and hostname allowlist
steps: Set security.ssrf.denyPolicy to block internal/private ranges
Enable audit logging for blocked fetch attempts
Update to OpenClaw v2026.2.12+ which includes built-in SSRF deny

owasp_mappings.rationale: Finding 'World-readable sensitive file: exec-approvals.json' (high) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft). Category: insecure_permissions.
Finding 'World-readable sensitive file: openclaw.json' (high) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft). Category: insecure_permissions.
Finding 'Agent config directory world-accessible: .openclaw' (high) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft). Category: insecure_permissions.
Finding 'Gateway bound to non-loopback interface' (critical) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft), ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents). Category: network_exposure.
Finding 'No WebSocket origin validation configured' (high) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft), ASI01 (Agent Goal Hijack / Prompt Injection). Category: missing_auth.
Finding 'Gateway auth missing on non-loopback interface' (critical) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft), ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents). Category: missing_auth.

Finding 'DM policy set to 'open' — anyone can message the agent' (critical) maps to ASI01 (Agent Goal Hijack / Prompt Injection), ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents), ASI10 (Misaligned Behaviors / Unintended Actions). Category: insecure_config.

Finding 'Group policy is 'open' — agent responds in any group' (high) maps to ASI01 (Agent Goal Hijack / Prompt Injection), ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents). Category: insecure_config.

Finding 'Full tool profile with open inbound access' (critical) maps to ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents), ASI01 (Agent Goal Hijack / Prompt Injection), ASI10 (Misaligned Behaviors / Unintended Actions). Category: insecure_default.

Finding 'Sandboxing disabled with full tool access and open input' (high) maps to ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents), ASI08 (Uncontrolled Cascading / Runaway Agents). Category: insecure_default.
Finding 'Authentication disabled on non-loopback agent' (critical) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft), ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents). Category: missing_auth.

Finding 'No SSRF protection configured for URL-based inputs' (high) maps to ASI05 (Privilege Compromise / Credential Theft), ASI02 (Excessive Agency / Overprivileged Agents). Category: insecure_default.
